TopicTitle: Best things to watch on TV while playing KSP

Articles.Content:
So, my TV is run by my computer, because I'm a huge geek, so I can choose whatever I want to watch while playing the KSP (via Netflix or files I have on the computer). I have several shows that are right in line with the KSP, but my favorite is "When We Left Earth", a series based on the US manned spaceflight program, from Mercury to the Space Shuttle. I think there are 6 episodes, plus bonuses. It is a great series, and is right in line with the amazing accomplishments you are making on Kerbin.

I have a few other space-related series that I watch, but this one is one of my favorites.

What do you watch when you play KSP?

http://www.amazon.com/When-We-Left-Earth-Missions/dp/B001BEK8CY
I love When We Left Earth! It is so complete.
"From the Earth to the Moon" would probably go well with KSP. I'll have to check out "When we Left Earth." Is that on Netflix?

"From the Earth to the Moon" would probably go well with KSP.

The first time I landed on the Mun, I was spending my day split between watching through the series and playing KSP. It fit very well.
I watch star trek ds9 or stargate while playing KSP. It is more like listening than watching since I watched them hundreds of times before.

I rewatched When We Left Earth just a few days ago! I did find it difficult to Kerbal while it was playing as I was getting to engrossed!

Only seen From the Earth of the Moon once. Will be snagging my dads copy on Monday to rewatch.

Also watched Apollo 13 again last night.

Alien (1979)

The Thing (1982, best year)

(1999) (great movie, if for the wrong reasons)

...

I also enjoy watching cooking shows while playing KSP.

Ditto on 'From the Earth to the Moon', great show to have on in the background as a mood enhancer. What I really like is playing though is my copy of Spacecraft Films' Apollo 11 - it's got a lot of the footage of the mission on those discs, from assembly to splashdown, it's great!
Deep Impact has a really cool craft
It's listening rather than watching, but I often have the Astronomy Cast podcast on, it's really good with each episode on a different subject, currently up to episode 392!

Just about any space travel science fiction series or movie should work for you who watch something else while playing KSP. When I play the game, I don't watch any movies or shows. Its a matter of preference, I suppose.

I know it is a terrible movie but this...

I do like the fact that it was done found footage style, which normally I hate those kind of movies.

If it's launch, then it's probably Apollo 13

And if it's something really complicated, then it's probably the Jupiter aerobraking scene from the film of 2010...sadly I couldn't find a clip of it.

For two series that aren't focused on human spaceflight, check out The Universe and How the Universe Works.

"From the Earth to the Moon" would probably go well with KSP. I'll have to check out "When we Left Earth." Is that on Netflix?

Didn't notice if anyone answered this. But YES it is on Netflix! I watched it there first earlier this year, and then got a copy on BluRay for Christmas. It's very nicely done.

Ditto on From the Earth to the Moon and Apollo 13 of course.

I usually don't watch anything other than KSP youtube vids while playing KSP, since I get too engrossed in the show. But in general, I do frequently get in the mood for some cheesy sci-fi.

It's a shame most other space movies are relatively poor or cheesy, but I can enjoy a bad movie too. I recently rewatched Armageddon and Deep Impact, and was even more critical of them than when they first came out (often I'll be more forgiving on a later viewing). Particularly Armageddon. Holy crap, that movie is one stinking pile of Hollywood cliches and tons of really awful science.

But just for the fun of watching a movie that involves SPACE, bad science and all, I did get a kick out of a few of these, to varying degrees:

Apollo 18 (yeah, I know)

Moon

The Last Days on Mars

Europa Report

Mission to Mars (anything with Gary Sinise gets a little bit more forgiveness from me. Not sure why. He's just cool.)

Sunshine

Solaris

And of course we have Gravity now.

I found Red Planet to be wholly forgettable.

But I also pounded through all of Space: 1999 on youtube over a year ago, and that was fun (and horrendously cheesy of course).
Sunshine! One of my favorites! two thumbs up!

I watch Scott Manley's Youtube video's on my laptop while playing KSP on my PC ( his voice and accent sounds really relaxing ).
